So this is fixing a CMake regression?
Also seems like the obvious time to document `BITCOIN_GENBUILD_NO_GIT` (#31999) 
cc @whitslack

> So this is fixing a CMake regression?

If so, could it be demonstrated that something works in v28.1 but is broken in v29.0rc3?

> > So this is fixing a CMake regression?
> 
> If so, could it be demonstrated that something works in v28.1 but is broken in v29.0rc3?

The PR's author [mentioned](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/32217#discussion_r2029437679) only one explicit case where this PR might alter behaviour:

> If any parent directory is a git repository, but the source directory is not

Accordingly, I have verified any related behavioural changes in this scenario:
- Creating an empty git repository:
```
$ mkdir test_tarballs
$ cd test_tarballs
$ git init .
$ git commit --allow-empty -m "Initial commit"
$ git rev-parse --short=12 HEAD
76e386813b40
```

- Testing the [v28.1 tarball](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.1/bitcoin-28.1.tar.gz):
```
$ wget https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.1/bitcoin-28.1.tar.gz
$ tar xf bitcoin-28.1.tar.gz 
$ cd bitcoin-28.1
$ ./autogen.sh 
$ ./configure 
$ make -j $(nproc)
$ cat src/obj/build.h
#define BUILD_GIT_COMMIT "76e386813b40"
$ ./src/bitcoind -version | head -1
Bitcoin Core version v28.1.0
```

- Testing the [v29.0rc3 tarball](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.0/test.rc3/bitcoin-29.0rc3.tar.gz):
```
$ wget https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.0/test.rc3/bitcoin-29.0rc3.tar.gz
$ tar xf bitcoin-29.0rc3.tar.gz 
$ cd bitcoin-29.0rc3
$ cmake -B build
$ cmake --build build -j $(nproc)
$ cat build/src/bitcoin-build-info.h
#define BUILD_GIT_COMMIT "76e386813b40"
$ ./build/bin/bitcoind -version | head -1
Bitcoin Core daemon version v29.0.0rc3
```

- Testing a pre-release untagged commit from the 28.x branch:
```
$ tar xf /home/hebasto/GIT_ARCHIVES/bitcoin-1248d0da2279.tar.gz
$ cd bitcoin-1248d0da2279
$ ./autogen.sh 
$ ./configure 
$ make -j $(nproc)
$ cat src/obj/build.h
#define BUILD_GIT_COMMIT "76e386813b40"
hebasto@TS-P340:~/dev/test_tarballs/bitcoin-1248d0da2279$ ./src/bitcoind -version | head -1
Bitcoin Core version v28.99.0-76e386813b40
```

- Testing a pre-release untagged commit from the 29.x branch:
```
$ tar xf /home/hebasto/GIT_ARCHIVES/bitcoin-8cb6ab0b971a.tar.gz
$ cd bitcoin-8cb6ab0b971a
$ cmake -B build
$ cmake --build build -j $(nproc)
$ cat build/src/bitcoin-build-info.h
#define BUILD_GIT_COMMIT "76e386813b40"
$ ./build/bin/bitcoind -version | head -1
Bitcoin Core daemon version v28.99.0-76e386813b40
```

As demonstrated above, there is no change in behaviour and no indication of a "CMake regression".

Maybe remove this PR from the 29.0 milestone?

Tested 903fc971ed6b13da7260f5e5a8e3e9e7372b2bd7 on Ubuntu 24.10.

When building from my local Bitcoin Core repository:
- on the master branch @ 8cb6ab0b971a27ba255ad6a48959a8c7b84c00f3:
```
$ cmake --build build -t bitcoin_clientversion
[1/3] Generating bitcoin-build-info.h
$ cat build/src/bitcoin-build-info.h 
#define BUILD_GIT_COMMIT "8cb6ab0b971a"
```
- this PR:
```
$ cmake --build build -t bitcoin_clientversion
[3/3] Linking CXX static library lib/libbitcoin_clientversion.a
$ cat build/src/bitcoin-build-info.h 
// No build information available
```

The PR's behaviour is evidently incorrect.

>As demonstrated above, there is no change in behaviour and no indication of a "CMake regression".

The regression occurred in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18556 and would have been fixed by #18902

>Testing the [v29.0rc3 tarball](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.0/test.rc3/bitcoin-29.0rc3.tar.gz):
>```
>$ wget https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.0/test.rc3/bitcoin-29.0rc3.tar.gz
>$ tar xf bitcoin-29.0rc3.tar.gz 
>$ cd bitcoin-29.0rc3
>$ cmake -B build
>$ cmake --build build -j $(nproc)
>$ cat build/src/bitcoin-build-info.h
>#define BUILD_GIT_COMMIT "76e386813b40"
>$ ./build/bin/bitcoind -version | head -1
>Bitcoin Core daemon version v29.0.0rc3
>```

v29.0rc3 is not 76e386813b40

> > As demonstrated above, there is no change in behaviour and no indication of a "CMake regression".
> 
> The regression occurred in #18556 and would have been fixed by #18902

So, it's not caused by the migration from Autotools to CMake.

> > Testing the [v29.0rc3 tarball](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.0/test.rc3/bitcoin-29.0rc3.tar.gz):
> > ```
> > $ wget https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-29.0/test.rc3/bitcoin-29.0rc3.tar.gz
> > $ tar xf bitcoin-29.0rc3.tar.gz 
> > $ cd bitcoin-29.0rc3
> > $ cmake -B build
> > $ cmake --build build -j $(nproc)
> > $ cat build/src/bitcoin-build-info.h
> > #define BUILD_GIT_COMMIT "76e386813b40"
> > $ ./build/bin/bitcoind -version | head -1
> > Bitcoin Core daemon version v29.0.0rc3
> > ```
> 
> v29.0rc3 is not 76e386813b40

Sure it is not. Because the build happens within another "parent" git repository:
> > If any parent directory is a git repository, but the source directory is not
> 
> Accordingly, I have verified any related behavioural changes in this scenario:
> 
>    * Creating an empty git repository:
> 
> 
> ```
> $ mkdir test_tarballs
> $ cd test_tarballs
> $ git init .
> $ git commit --allow-empty -m "Initial commit"
> $ git rev-parse --short=12 HEAD
> 76e386813b40
> ```

Bugfix: Only use git for build info if the repository is actually the right one

Original-Github-Pull: #7522

events.body:
> Also seems like the obvious time to document `BITCOIN_GENBUILD_NO_GIT` (#31999)

This is still unaddressed.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -40,6 +40,22 @@ if(NOT "$ENV{BITCOIN_GENBUILD_NO_GIT}" STREQUAL "1")
       OUTPUT_STRIP_TRAILING_WHITESPACE
       ERROR_QUIET
     )
+    if(IS_INSIDE_WORK_TREE)
+      # This check ensures that we are actually part of the intended git repository, and not just getting info about some unrelated git repository that the code happens to be in a directory under
+      execute_process(
+        COMMAND ${GIT_EXECUTABLE} status --porcelain -uall --ignored cmake/script/GenerateBuildInfo.cmake
+        WORKING_DIRECTORY ${WORKING_DIR}
+        RESULT_VARIABLE SCRIPT_STATUS_EXITCODE
+        OUTPUT_VARIABLE SCRIPT_STATUS
+        OUTPUT_STRIP_TRAILING_WHITESPACE
+        ERROR_QUIET
+      )
+      if(SCRIPT_STATUS_EXITCODE)
+        set(IS_INSIDE_WORK_TREE 0)
+      elseif(SCRIPT_STATUS MATCHES "^$|\\?")
+        set(IS_INSIDE_WORK_TREE 0)
+      endif()

+      # This check ensures that we are actually part of the intended git repository, and not just getting info about some unrelated git repository that the code happens to be in a directory under
+      execute_process(
+        COMMAND ${GIT_EXECUTABLE} status --porcelain -uall --ignored cmake/script/GenerateBuildInfo.cmake
+        WORKING_DIRECTORY ${WORKING_DIR}
+        RESULT_VARIABLE SCRIPT_STATUS_EXITCODE
+        OUTPUT_VARIABLE SCRIPT_STATUS
+        OUTPUT_STRIP_TRAILING_WHITESPACE

comments.body:
I disagree somewhat @hebasto, though I don't think it's very important.

Sure, the user can disable `git` entirely if they know they're not building directly in a git working tree for the repository, but it doesn't seem unreasonable to me that the code automatically works correctly by not treating it as a git build if it happens to be unpacked tarball in an unrelated git working tree.

That said, if this already doesn't work correctly it's not a blocker for 29.x.
